title: Ticket #2194: Filter "no idle jobs" submitters prior to phase 4.1
description: The calculation of submitter limits will take submitters into account who have no idle jobs, and will not use slots given to them. This results in extra "spins" in the negotiation loop that could be avoided. Pre-filtering submitters with no idle jobs can reduce unnecessary iterations.
remarks:
2011-May-26 16:18:22 by eje:
repro/test:

Configuration: 

$ more 95.bz706512.config
NEGOTIATOR_CONSIDER_PREEMPTION = FALSE
NUM_CPUS = 10
GROUP_NAMES = a, b
GROUP_QUOTA_a = 5
GROUP_QUOTA_b = 5

Test uses two submissions. The first submits a single job under submitter "a.u1": 

$ more a.u1.jsub
universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 300
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup="a.u1"
queue 1

The second will submit 4 jobs for submitter "a.u2": 

$ more a.u2.jsub
universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 300
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup="a.u2"
queue 4

The test is to first submit "a.u1.jsub", and let it negotiate. After it has negotiated, submit "a.u2.jsub."

Before the fix, you will see this: The first Phase-4.1 spin is "a.u1" negotiating. The next three spins (4.1,4.2,4.3) are "a.u2" negotiating. You can see that on the first spin, "a.u2" is given a submitter limit of 2.5, even though 4 slots are available, since it is also including submitter "a.u1" in its computation. (Note, the third spin 4.3 is an artifact of #2195) 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e 'Phase 4..:' -e 'Negotiating with.* at' -e
'submitterLimit *='
05/26/11 11:22:01 Phase 4.1:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 11:22:01   Negotiating with a.u1@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:34321>
05/26/11 11:22:01     submitterLimit    = 1.000000
05/26/11 11:22:21 Phase 4.1:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 11:22:21   Negotiating with a.u2@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:34321>
05/26/11 11:22:21     submitterLimit    = 2.482556
05/26/11 11:22:22 Phase 4.2:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 11:22:22   Negotiating with a.u2@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:34321>
05/26/11 11:22:22     submitterLimit    = 2.000000
05/26/11 11:22:22 Phase 4.3:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 11:22:22   Negotiating with a.u2@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:34321>
05/26/11 11:22:22     submitterLimit    = 1.000000

After the fix, we see that "a.u2" gets 4 slots, and "a.u1" is filtered due to its having no idle jobs to negotiate (Note, here the second spin 4.2 is manifestation of ticket #2195 -- once that is fixed I would expect "a.u2" to negotiate in one spin) 

$ tail -f NegotiatorLog | grep -e 'Phase 4..:' -e
'Negotiating with.* at' -e 'submitterLimit *=' -e 'Filtering submitter'
05/26/11 12:03:31 Phase 4.1:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 12:03:31   Negotiating with a.u1@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:47753>
05/26/11 12:03:31     submitterLimit    = 1.000000
05/26/11 12:03:51 Filtering submitter a.u1@localdomain with no idle jobs
05/26/11 12:03:51 Phase 4.1:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 12:03:51   Negotiating with a.u2@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:47753>
05/26/11 12:03:51     submitterLimit    = 4.000000
05/26/11 12:03:51 Phase 4.2:  Negotiating with schedds ...
05/26/11 12:03:51   Negotiating with a.u2@localdomain at <192.168.1.2:47753>
05/26/11 12:03:51     submitterLimit    = 1.000000

2011-Jun-15 18:19:46 by eje:
See also #2230

2011-Jun-27 10:28:14 by danb:
Thanks for the patch!

Perhaps the log message, "Filtering submitter %s with no idle jobs" would be clearer if it were "Ignoring submitter %s with no idle jobs".

You are only applying this filter when consideration of preemption is disabled. I think that is prudent for now, but perhaps something we should revisit later. The reason I think it is prudent for now is described in #2270: the spinning pie algorithm does not converge to fair share allocations when preemption is allowed. I am worried that this problem could be exacerbated by dropping submitters earlier in the cycle than we do already.
